008 *******************************************************************************/
009
010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
013
014import java.util.Locale;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017
018/**
019 * This class represents complex numbers. Instances are immutable.
020 * Methods are mostly defined to be compatible with 
021 * org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex and (newer)
022 * org.apache.commons.numbers.complex.Complex.
023 * Arithmetic operations are generally more precise than with the
024 * Apache implementation.
025 * 
026 * @author W. Burger
027 * @version 2022/07/05
028 */
029public class Complex {
030        
031        /** Real unit value (z = 1 + i 0). */
032        public static final Complex ONE = new Complex(1, 0);
033        /** Complex zero value (z = 0 + i 0). */
034        public static final Complex ZERO = new Complex(0, 0);
035        /** Imaginary unit value (z = 0 + i 1). */
036        public static final Complex I = new Complex(0, 1);
037
038        /** The real part of this complex number */
039        public final double re;
040        /** The imaginary part of this complex number */
041        public final double im;
042
043        /**
044         * Constructor.
045         * @param re real part
046         * @param im imaginary part
047         */
048        public Complex(double re, double im) {
049                this.re = re;
050                this.im = im;
051        }
052
053        /**
054         * Constructor
055         * @param z complex quantity, which is duplicated
056         */
057        public Complex(Complex z) {
058                this.re = z.re;
059                this.im = z.im;
060        }
061
062        /**
063         * Create a complex quantity on the unit circle with angle 'phi':
064         * e^{\i \phi} = \cos(\phi) + \i \cdot \sin(\phi)
065         * @param phi angle
066         */
067        public Complex(double phi) {
068                this.re = Math.cos(phi);
069                this.im = Math.sin(phi);
070        }
071        
072        
073        public Complex(Pnt2d pnt) {
074                this.re = pnt.getX();
075                this.im = pnt.getY();
076        }
077        
078        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
079
080        /**
081         * Returns the absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
082         * its radius or distance from the origin.
083         * @return the absolute value
084         */
085        public double abs() {
086                return Math.sqrt(this.abs2());
087        }
088
089        /**
090         * Returns the squared absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
091         * its squared radius or distance from the origin.
092         * @return the squared absolute value
093         */
094        public double abs2() {
095                return re * re + im * im;
096        }
097
098        /**
099         * Returns the 'argument' of this complex number, i.e.,
100         * its angle relative to the real axis. 
101         * @return the argument (in radians)
102         */
103        public double arg() {
104                return Math.atan2(im, re);
105        }
106
107        /**
108     * Returns the conjugate {@code z*} of this complex number, i.e,
109     * if {@code z = a + i b} then {@code z* = a - i b}.
110     * @return the complex conjugate
111     */
112        public Complex conjugate() {
113                return new Complex(this.re, -this.im);
114        }
115
116        /**
117         * Adds a complex quantity to this complex number and returns
118         * a new complex number.
119         * @param z complex value
120         * @return the sum of this complex number and {@code z}
121         */
122        public Complex add(Complex z) {
123                return new Complex(this.re + z.re,  this.im + z.im);
124        }
125
126        /**
127         * Rotates this complex number by the angle {@code phi} and returns
128         * a new complex number.
129         * @param phi the angle (in radians)
130         * @return the rotated complex value
131         */
132        public Complex rotate(double phi) {
133                return this.multiply(new Complex(phi));
134        }
135
136        @Override
137    public String toString() {
138        return String.format(Locale.US, "(%.9f, %.9f)", re, im);
139    }
140        
141    /**
142     * Returns true if the real or imaginary component of this complex number
143     * is {@code NaN}.
144     * @return true if {@code NaN}, otherwise false
145     */
146        public boolean isNaN() {
147                return Double.isNaN(this.getRe()) || Double.isNaN(this.getIm());
148        }
149        
150        /**
151         * Returns the real part of this complex number.
152         * @return the real part
153         */
154        public double getRe() {
155                return this.re;
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * Returns the imaginary part of this complex number.
160         * @return the imaginary part
161         */
162        public double getIm() {
163                return this.im;
164        }
165
166        /**
167         * Multiplies this complex number with another complex quantity {@code z2} and returns
168         * a new complex number.
169         * @param z2 a complex quantity
170         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code z2}
171         */
172        public Complex multiply(Complex z2) {
173                // (x1 + i y1)(x2 + i y2) = (x1 x2 + y1 y2) + i (x1 y2 + y1 x2)
174                Complex z1 = this;
175                double x = z1.re * z2.re - z1.im * z2.im;
176                double y = z1.re * z2.im + z1.im * z2.re;
177                return new Complex(x, y);
178        }
179        
180        /**
181         * Multiplies this complex number with the scalar factor {@code s} and returns
182         * a new complex number.
183         * @param s a scalar factor
184         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code s}
185         */
186        public Complex multiply(double s) {
187                return new Complex(this.re * s, this.im * s);
188        }
189        
190         /**
191     * Returns of value of this complex number raised to the power of {@code k}.
192     * @param k the exponent
193     * @return {@code z^k}
194     */
195        public Complex pow(int k) {
196                if (k < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("exponent k >= 0 expected");
197                Complex prod = new Complex(1, 0);
198                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
199                        prod = prod.multiply(this);
200                }
201                return prod;
202        }
203        
204        /**
205         * Returns a 2-element array with the real and imaginary part of this
206         * complex number.
207         * @return (re, im)
208         */
209        public double[] toArray() {
210                return new double[] {this.re, this.im};
211        }
212        
213        @Override
214        public boolean equals(Object other) {
215        if (other == this) {
216            return true;
217        }       
218        if (other instanceof Complex) {
219                final Complex z = (Complex) other;
220//              return Double.compare(this.re, z.re) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, z.im) == 0;
221                return this.equals(z, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
222        }
223        return false;
224        }
225        
226        public boolean equals(Complex z, double tolerance) {
227                return isZero(this.re - z.re, tolerance) 
228                                && isZero(this.im - z.im, tolerance);
229        }
230        
231        public boolean equals(double a, double b) {
232                //return Double.compare(this.re, a) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, b) == 0;
233                return this.equals(a, b, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
234        }
235        
236        public boolean equals(double a, double b, double tolerance) {
237                return isZero(this.re - a, tolerance) 
238                                && isZero(this.im - b, tolerance);
239        }
240
241}
